alert.note: Alert for Fayette (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 08 at 5:42PM CDT until May 08 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Fayette County in south central Texas... * Until 745 PM CDT. * At 542 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Muldoon, Floy and O`Quinn. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
